lines.line: Get lost, outlander! I've no time for you!
Who is that? Identify yourself!
It's me. What are you doing out here?
Nothing... Just carving these horribly broken pieces of driftwood.
In the middle of nowhere.
In damp clothing.
Okay...
Well, have a nice day.
Wait! Would you do me a favour?
What kind of a favour?
Look, you see that heap of driftwood over there? That is my ship, and all that is left of my one shot at making my ancestors proud of me.
My family have always been great explorers and seafarers, and I recently set off on my maiden voyage.
However, a big storm - yes, a huge storm in fact - blew my ship onto the rocks. Three times.
I've been sitting here ever since, trying to think of a way to make my family proud, and if you will help me...I think I have a way.
Okay, I'll help you out.
Thank you! I don't have much apart from my carvings, some driftwood and the map that I was following when I had my little...
...accident.
If you help me out, then I'll gladly hand it over.
So, what is your plan?
Well, I have a little food left, although it's a little briny.

If you take a couple of carvings to my wife and son in the village over the hill and tell them that I sent you with them from a distant island, then I can wait out here for a week or so before returning.
Alright, hand me over the carvings and I'll be on my way.
Well, none of these are any good. I'll need some fresh wood from a decent tree.
When I was swimming for my life I saw an odd-looking windswept tree to the east of here, up that cliff.
Could you bring me some of that wood so I can work it?
Wow, you must have pretty good eyes to be able to see a single tree from the water during a heavy storm.
Yes...great eyes...they run in the family.
Possibly later, when you don't smell so damp.
Bah! Well, if you aren't going to help, do me a favour and jump off that cliff!
So... Got the logs for me yet?
Not yet. I just popped back to see how you were doing.
Still cold. Still damp. 'Bout average, really.
Olaf, I cut some logs from the tree. Here's the wood.
Wonderful! I'll carve them up now.
Done!
That's it?
Yep!
This is for my wife, Ingrid. I'm sure she will love it. Tell her it's tribal or something.
Sure...
And this one is for my son, Volf. Kids love planks in my experience. Tell him I said hello.
Alright. They live in Rellekka, right?
Yes. Hurry back! And don't forget the story: I'm not here, I'm someplace far away.
So, how did my wife like her carving?
I don't know... I've still got it.
Well, hurry up and give it to her then!
She was very happy with it!
Wonderful!
I wish I could see her again...
Well, if this plan works out you will be able too, right?
Yes, you're right.
Did my son like his present? I'll bet he was thrilled.
I'll bet he will be... but I've still got it.
Well, take your time over it, why don't you.
Excuse me, but are you Ingrid? The same Ingrid that is married to Olaf Hradson?
Yes I am. Why do you ask?
I am a friend of your husband. He sent me here with a gift for you.
An expensive, exotic gift from the far-flung and tropical shores of the Island of Obscurity.
How wonderful! I assumed from the way the big oaf always referred to the rigging as 'big strings' that he couldn't navigate his way out of a soggy paper bag. So, can I see the gift he sent?
Certainly! Here it is. He sends his best wishes along with it.
I see. It looks like a log with 'Olaf was here' carved in it.
It's tribal! Very tribal! I watched the natives carve it myself.
Well, since you have come such a long way, you can have this. I baked it this morning, so it's still nice and fresh.
Oh, thank you! Enjoy your Obscurian Tribal Artefact(tm). It has a million-and-one uses!
Hello again! Have you any word from my husband?
Err, no, not yet. It takes a while for the messages to reach me, you know.
Well, when you do, tell him we'll be more than happy to see him again.
Volf? Son of Olaf Hradson?
Yes. Do I know you?
No, but I do know your father. He sent me with a present for you from, err...
From the Island of Obscurity.
Oh! That was fast! He only set off recently, and I was wondering how he was doing. So, where is this gift?
Right here. Enjoy!
What is it?
Very valuable. Have a nice time!
Wait! Here, take this. I was going to have it for my lunch, but I suppose you can have it in payment.
Thanks! Enjoy your new...thing!
Hello again! Does my father send any word...or treasures like before?
Not today, but if he does, you will be the first to know.
Olaf, are you all right?
So...cold...need...fire.
I delivered your carvings as you asked. Your family would like to see you again.
Here, let me get you to the village before you freeze to death.
I won't...go...anywhere. I don't...care if I...freeze.
I'd rather...die...than suffer...the shame.
Just get the...fire burning. Use...these.
Well, at least give me the map like you promised!
Too...cold...to...hear...whining.
So...very...cold. Almost cold enough to tear up an old map with my fevered shivering. Cough, cough.
Ahhhhhhhh... Much better.
Well, I'm glad you're happy. Can I have that map now?
Well, okay...but could I have a little of that food first? I've had nothing but seaweed and biscuits for the past week.
Not a chance.
Okay, okay, I was only asking.
Well, regardless, you've more than earned this map. It was the last one my grandfather, Sven the Helmsman, ever made.
It is supposed to show the location of one of his stashes of treasure, but I have never been able to decipher the strange, runic inscriptions that point the way.
I wish you luck!
Well, thanks. What will you do now?
I'll sit here and practice carving.
If you pass this way again, I'll be glad if you drop my next load of work off with my family.
That or bring me some food before I starve. Whichever.
Hey! I'm trying to carve and you're standing in my light! Move it!
Olaf, I seem to have lost your map, can I have another?
You lost the treasured map of Sven the Helmsman? How dare you!
You'd best take better care of this one, or else!
Slay... Outlander... Intruder!

characters.name: Olaf Hradson
characters.description: Middle-aged male, Scandinavian accent, weathered and hesitant tone, a Fremennik aspiring explorer whose failed voyage left him stranded and ashamed, balancing desperation with stubborn pride.

characters.name: Ingrid Hradson
characters.description: Middle-aged female, Scandinavian accent, warm but skeptical tone, a practical Fremennik housewife who doubts her husband's seafaring abilities but remains supportive and nurturing.

characters.name: Volf Olafson
characters.description: Young male teenager, Scandinavian accent, eager and naive tone, an enthusiastic Fremennik youth who idolizes his father and believes tales of adventure without question.

characters.name: Ulfric
characters.description: Ancient undead male, deep gravelly voice with ghostly echo, menacing and hostile tone, an undead Fremennik captain risen to guard his treasure with resentful fury.
